'''''Amanita altipes''''', also called the '''yellow long-stem amanita''', is a species of [[agaric]] fungus found on soil in [[conifer]]ous (''[[Abies]]'', ''[[Picea]]'') and broadleaved (''[[Betula]]'', ''[[Quercus]]'', ''[[Salix]]'') woodland in southwestern [[People's Republic of China|China]] up to an altitude of {{convert|4000|m}}.<ref name=VGuide>{{cite web|last=OVGuide|title=Amanita altipes video|url=http://www.ovguide.com/amanita-altipes-9202a8c04000641f800000000560109f#|work=All Media Guide (AMG)|access-date=2011-03-19|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110807213159/http://www.ovguide.com/amanita-altipes-9202a8c04000641f800000000560109f|archive-date=2011-08-07|url-status=dead}}</ref> The [[botanical name|specific epithet]] ''altipes'' means "referring to the long stipe", and it suits the species as it has a longer stipe compared to its relatives.<ref name="Yang 2004"/>

==Description==

This is a small to medium-sized agaric with a distinctively yellowish overall coloration. The [[pileus (mycology)|cap]] has a diameter of up to {{convert|9|cm|in|abbr=on}} and is yellow, often brownish towards the centre. The appearance of the cap may be convex to plano-convex. The volva is present as felty, floccose patches, 2–5 mm wide and up to 1 mm thick. Unlike many of its relatives (for example, the ''[[Amanita pantherina]]''), the remnants of the [[universal veil]] do not usually persist on the cap, being easily washed away by rain.<ref name="urlTulloss"/> The yellowish [[stipe (mycology)|stipe]] is relatively long (up to 16 cm), and usually tapers upwards. There is a large, persistent [[annulus (mycology)|ring]]. The [[lamella (mycology)|gills]] are free, crowded, and white to cream-colored to yellowish. The short gills (lamellulae) are truncate, numerous, and are evenly distributed. The [[basidiospore|spores]] measure 8.0–10.0 by 7.5–9.5 [[micrometre|µm]] and are spherical (or nearly so) and [[inamyloid]]. There are no [[clamp connection|clamps]] present at the bases of [[basidia]]. The [[trama (mycology)|flesh]] is white in color and inedible.

==Habitat and distribution==

This species is widespread in southwestern [[People's Republic of China|China]], mostly in [[Yunnan]].<ref name="Zhang 2004"/>  It has also been reported that it is found in eastern [[Himalayas]] and adjacent regions.<ref name="Yang 2004"/> It grows on soil in coniferous (''Abies'', ''Picea'') and broadleaved (''Betula'', ''Quercus'', ''Salix'') woodland in southwestern China up to an altitude of {{convert|4000|m}}.
